page.title: 03St.John's Church.
page.content: { St.John's Church}with it's towering spire reaching 150 ft.into the sky dominates the northern end of Weymouth Esplanade. Begun in 1850,it was completed four years later.The building was designed by Thomas Talbot Bury,a pupil of Augustin Pugin,in the style of the 14th century. The stone used in the building is Bincombe stone,although Bath and Caen stone were used for detailing. The tower has two bells,no longer in use,and a clock,which was renovated and returned to working order in 1985. A visitor to the church will enjoy the quiet of the interior and be able to see the beauty of the stained glass windows. On Sundays the church has a congregation of 200-250 people meeting to worship God.
